snippet: At least three people were killed and 79 hurt at the rail station in Urumqi, Xinjiang, where President Xi Jinping had been visiting.
abstract: Assailants with explosives and knives kill three people and wound at least 79 outside a railroad station in Urumqi, capital of western China’s restive Xinjiang region; there is no word on identities of assailants or whether any have been captured.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Jonathan Ansfield from Beijing. Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: At least three people were killed and 79 hurt at the rail station in Urumqi, Xinjiang, where President Xi Jinping had been visiting.

headline.main: Assailants Attack Train Station in Restive Western China
headline.print_headline: Assailants Attack Train Station in Restive Western China
